Key Match Events: TJ Friedl went 4 for 4 with a two-run homer.
Nick Martinez pitched six strong innings for his third straight win.
Jake Fraley had three hits, including a solo homer.
Cincinnati scored nine times in the fourth inning.
Byron Buxton had an RBI single for the Twins.
Simeon Woods Richardson worked out of a bases-loaded, none-out jam in the third inning.
Noelvi Marte doubled to give the Reds a 3-1 lead.
Jonathan India followed with a two-run single.
Spencer Steer had a two-run double.
Friedl hit a two-run homer, his second longball in as many nights.
Post-Match Reflections: Jake Fraley commented on the significance of the win against a playoff team.
Kyle Farmer emphasized the need for a mindset shift to take control of games.
Rocco Baldelli reflected on the team's need to play with urgency and relaxation.
Kyle Farmer noted the team's frustration and focus on immediate results.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Brent Suter pitched three scoreless innings to earn his second save of the season.
Minnesota remained 2 1/2 games ahead of Detroit for the final American League playoff berth but dropped 3 1/2 games behind Kansas City for the league’s second wild card.
Simeon Woods Richardson has failed to complete five innings in any of his last four starts.
Carlos Correa returned to the lineup for the first time since the All-Star break.
Others: Reds: RHP Hunter Greene (elbow soreness) is slated to throw live batting practice on Tuesday.
Twins: SS Carlos Correa (plantar fasciitis) returned to the lineup for the first time since the All-Star break.
Twins RHP David Festa (2-6, 5.08 ERA) starts Sunday’s series finale against RHP Rhett Lowder (1-1, 0.59).
